text:
Hello, my name
is Steve McQueen.

I’m the director, producer,
and co-writer of “Widows.”

So this scene is where the
four women come together
for the first time.

And Michelle
Rodriguez’s character

Linda brings in Belle,
played by Cynthia Erivo,
into the group.

And Veronica, played
by Viola Davis,
has a objection to this.
“This is not your place.
Please ask her to leave.”

“I’m standing here,
you can talk to me.”
“I don’t know you.”
“You don’t have to.
I’m happy to leave right now.”
“Wait, we need a driver.”

For me, this is America,
these four women

from four different
social classes

that come together
to make a team.

And I kept this
shot as a four-shot.

It never went into
closeup or a medium shot

because I wanted
that dynamism.

I wanted always to keep
those four as one.”
“You vouch for her?”
“I don’t require a vouch.”

In some ways, this
show is like a do-si-do,

like in English country
dancing where one goes in,

one goes out, one goes
in, one goes out.

“If you’re in, we need to
get you started right away.”
